snippet: A loft building in Brooklyn, once a factory, has racked up dozens of violations, but there is little the city can do about it.
abstract: Vivian Yee The Appraisal column; loft building conversion at 239 Banker Street in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, continues to rack up Building Department violations, but there is little the city can do about the building's status; former sweater factory was converted into lofts without the city's permission and skirted zoning rules to get the work finished; area residents say building is an extreme example of gentrification run amok.
lead_paragraph: A loft building in Brooklyn, once a factory, has racked up dozens of violations, but there is little the city can do about it.

headline.seo: At Brooklyn Loft, Angry Neighbors and Dozens of Violations
headline.main: At Loft Conversion, City ‘Stop Work’ Order Failed to Stop It for Long
headline.print_headline: At Loft Conversion, City ‘Stop Work’ Order Failed to Stop It for Long
